import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Undo checkout transaction"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/assets/checkouts/undo-exchange-transaction"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Reverses a previously recorded checkout or check-in transaction. Use this when a transaction was recorded in error and you need to roll back the inventory movement without creating a compensating entry.

**Prerequisites**
1. **AssetCheckoutId + ExchangeActionId** - Identify the transaction via [POST /api/v1.0/assets/checkouts/transactions/query/get](/docs/api/assets/get-asset-checkout-transactions) or from the checkout/transfer response payload.

**Workflow Example**
1. Locate the erroneous transaction and record its identifiers.
2. [POST /api/v1.0/assets/checkouts/undo-exchange-transaction](/docs/api/assets/undo-asset-exchange-transaction) with the identifiers to reverse it.

**Minimal Required Fields**: `AssetCheckoutId`, `ExchangeActionId` (request body).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={undefined}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"required":true,"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"object","description":"Identifies a specific exchange transaction linked to a checkout.","properties":{"AssetCheckoutId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","description":"Checkout identifier."},"ExchangeActionId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","description":"Inventory action identifier representing the exchange."}},"required":["AssetCheckoutId","ExchangeActionId"],"title":"AssetExchangeTransactionDto"}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
